task: The user is experiencing issues with their phone service. They are unable to make or receive calls, and the status bar shows 'No Service'. Customer name: John Smith, phone number: 555-123-2002. They gave permission to pay all their overdue bills. They will consider the issue resolved when the status bar shows that they have signal.

messages.content: Hi, my phone has been showing 'No Service' for the past few hours. Can you help me figure out what's going on?

I can help with that. First, I need to verify your account so I can check your line status.

How would you like to verify?
- Phone number on the account
- Full name and date of birth
- Customer ID

While you grab that, here are quick checks you can do on your phone now:
- Check if Airplane Mode is accidentally on and turn it off if it is.
- Restart your phone.
- If it‚Äôs easy, reseat the SIM card (power off, remove SIM, reinsert, power back on).

Once you share your account details, I‚Äôll check for line suspensions or other issues and guide you step by step.
messages.reasoning_content: Begin troubleshooting No Service. First, identify the customer to access account/line details. Ask for either phone number, full name + DOB, or customer ID. Simultaneously, have user run on-device diagnostics: check_status_bar, check_sim_status, check_network_status. Based on results, proceed with Airplane Mode toggle, SIM reseat, APN reset, or check for line suspension.

messages.content:
I can verify with my phone number: 555-123-2002.

And just to confirm, do you want me to check if Airplane Mode is on first, or is there something you'd like me to do right away before we continue?

Also advise immediate quick checks (Airplane Mode, restart, reseat SIM) that can be done concurrently. After lookup, proceed based on findings: suspended -> address payment; inactive/billing issues -> refer to overdue policy; network/SIM/APN issues -> guided diagnostics via tools.

Thanks, John. I found your account and checked the line associated with 555-123-2002. That line is currently suspended, which explains the ‚ÄúNo Service‚Äù you‚Äôre seeing.

What I found:
- Line status: Suspended
- Recent bill: $150 due on Feb 19, 2025. This overdue amount is causing the suspension.

What to do right now on your phone (quick checks while we handle the bill):
- Confirm Airplane Mode is off.
- Restart the phone.
- If you can, reseat the SIM card: power off, remove and reinsert the SIM, then power back on.

Next steps to restore service:
1) I can send a payment request for the overdue bill of $150.
2) Once you pay it, I‚Äôll resume the line immediately. After that, you‚Äôll need to reboot your device to get service back.

Would you like me to send the payment request now? If so, please confirm and I‚Äôll initiate it.

Also advise immediate checks like Airplane Mode, restart, SIM reseat for completeness. After payment, send resume_line to restore service and instruct reboot.

messages.content: Yes, please go ahead and send me the payment request for the overdue bill. I‚Äôll work on the quick checks while you do that.

If you don‚Äôt see the payment request right away, let me know and I can resend it.

messages.content:
Restarting network services...
Status Bar: ‚úàÔ∏è Airplane Mode | üîã 80%
Status Bar: ‚úàÔ∏è Airplane Mode | üîã 80%
My phone rebooted, but I‚Äôm still seeing Airplane Mode enabled in the status bar. The device is not showing any network signal yet. What should I do next?

Let‚Äôs get Airplane Mode turned off first.

- Open your phone‚Äôs Settings (or pull down the quick settings panel).
- Look for the Airplane Mode toggle and tap it to switch it OFF.

After Airplane Mode is off:
- Wait 30‚Äì60 seconds for the network to reconnect.
- Check your status bar again for signal bars and the carrier name.

If you still don‚Äôt see signal after turning Airplane Mode off:
- Confirm Mobile Data is ON in quick settings or Settings > Network & Internet > Mobile Network.
- If available, try toggling Mobile Data OFF and back ON once.
- Restart your phone one more time.

If none of the above brings signal back, tell me and we‚Äôll proceed with further steps.
messages.reasoning_content: Guide the user to toggle Airplane Mode off, then re-check status, with specific expected results and next steps if still no service.
